comment.text: This translation key is used to describe permissions related to portal ownership. It appears as a list header and item in a change portal owner dialog, indicating which actions an owner can perform on the portal.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'sahibi edə bilər:' is a literal translation and doesn't fully convey the nuance of 'can:' in this context. It suggests an ability, but 'can:' implies permission or capability within a system. A better translation would imply authorization or access.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation like 'məxususiyyətli istifadəçi qədər:' (meaning 'as much as a privileged user') or 'məxususiyyətli istifadəçinin imkanı:' (meaning 'the capability of a privileged user'). The best choice depends on the specific functionality being described.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'собственикът може:' (the owner can) is grammatically correct but doesn't fully capture the intended meaning of 'owner can:' which implies a list or set of capabilities. A more accurate translation would emphasize ability or permission.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The translation could be improved to something like "{{productName}} собственикът има право да:" ({{productName}} owner has the right to:)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Besitzer können:' is grammatically correct, but might sound slightly unnatural in German. A more idiomatic phrasing would be 'kann/können'.
The translation 'Ο ιδιοκτήτης {{productName}} μπορεί:' is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Greek. It lacks the natural phrasing expected in a Greek sentence.

The translation "{{productName}}-ի տնօրինողը կարող է" is a literal translation and doesn't convey the intended meaning of '{{productName}} owner can:'. A more natural Armenian phrasing would be something like '{{productName}}-ի սեփականատերը կարող է' or '{{productName}}-ի հետ գործողությունը կարող է'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider '{{productName}}-ի սեփականատերը կարող է' or '{{productName}}-ի հետ գործողությունը կարող է'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "{{productName}}の所有者のアクセス権:" is not a direct or natural translation of "{{productName}} owner can:".  "アクセス権" specifically refers to access rights, while the English phrase is more general (abilities, privileges, etc.).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more general translation like "{{productName}}のオーナーは：" or "{{productName}}のユーザーは：" which more accurately reflects the English meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'හිමිකරුගේ වරප්‍රසාද:' doesn't fully convey the meaning of 'owner can:'. It translates to 'owner's privileges:' which implies a list of existing privileges rather than the ability to do something. A more accurate translation would convey 'owner can do:'.

The translation "Власник {{productName}}-а може:" is technically correct but slightly awkward. A more natural translation for 'owner can:' would be 'Власник {{productName}} може:'. The '-а' suffix is grammatically correct when referring to a masculine noun in the genitive case, but in this context, it sounds more like possession than capability.
